curated_text: Symbol: UNH. Year: 2023. Period: Q3. ReportType: Q10. Section: Competition and Market Position. This section discusses competitors, market dynamics, and regulatory landscape.  Competitors mentioned: Medicare Advantage, Medicare, UnitedHealthcare, Consolidated, UnitedHealth Group, Diluted, Medicaid, the Condensed Consolidated Financial Statements, Optum Health, UnitedHealthcare Employer & Individual - Domestic, UnitedHealthcare Employer & Individual - Global, UnitedHealthcare Employer & Individual - Total, UnitedHealthcare Medicare & Retirement, UnitedHealthcare Community & State, Total UnitedHealthcare, 570 7 Medicare Supplement (Standardized, Total UnitedHealthcare - Domestic Medical, UnitedHealthcare - Medical, Optum Total, Optum Health Revenues, Optum Insight, CAPITAL RESOURCES Liquidity Summary, CMS, Financial Condition As, Capital Resources and Uses of Liquidity, Management’s Discussion and Analysis of Financial Condition, the Consolidated Financial Statements, Moody’s S&P, A3 Positive A+ Stable, Board of Directors, Consolidated Financial Statements. Context excerpt: competition to continue as the industry adapts to individual and employer needs. Government programs in the community and senior sector tend to receive lower rates of increase than the commercial market due to governmental budget pressures and lower cost trends. Medical Cost Trends. Our medical cost trends primarily relate to changes in unit costs, care activity and prescription drug costs. We endeavor to mitigate those increases by engaging physicians and consumers with information and helping them make clinically sound choices, with the objective of helping them achieve quality, affordable care. 14 Table of Contents Regulatory Trends and Uncertainties Medicare Advantage Rates. Medicare Advantage rate notices over the years have at times resulted in industry base rates well below industry forward medical trend. For example, the Final Notice for 2024 rates resulted in an industry base rate decrease, well short of what is an increasing industry forward medical cost trend, creating conti
